summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the indictment of two federal correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, for falsifying records related to inmate checks at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide. It details their alleged failure to perform required counts and rounds, and their false certifications that concealed this dereliction of duty.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Arrested and Detained
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was involved in an apparent suicide attempt at the MCC, leading to his transfer to suicide watch and then psychological observation.

events.title: Epstein Returned to SHU
events.description: Epstein was moved back to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with the MCC implementing additional safety measures, including placing him in the cell closest to the officers' desk.

events.title: Start of Officers' Shift and Failure to Conduct Checks
events.description: Correctional Officer Tova Noel began her shift in the SHU at 4:00 p.m. The indictment alleges that from approximately 10:30 p.m., no required inmate counts or rounds were conducted.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas discovered the body of Jeffrey Epstein, who had committed suicide by hanging himself earlier that morning while unobserved.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed and Officers Surrender
events.description: The indictment against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas was unsealed. They surrendered to authorities on this date.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the MCC
keyFacts: Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were indicted for falsifying records and conspiring to defraud the United States by failing to conduct mandated inmate checks at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019.

The indictment alleges that no correctional officer conducted any count or round of the Special Housing Unit from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 until approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein was discovered dead by suicide in his cell at approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019, during this period when no checks were performed.
The officers allegedly signed false certifications for five separate inmate counts that they never conducted.
Epstein had been placed in the SHU and assigned to the cell closest to the officers' desk due to risk factors for suicidality following an apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.
